column4: hi All, to day i've installed intrepid on desktop all works fine until the apt-get update - upgrade process,  now i'm not able to connect to the web, have you any suggestion on how to debug these problem ?
try "dhclient eth0" as root
i done the command, these the resutls (i manually copied it) : http://rafb.net/p/dlpCJV14.html
does "ifconfig" show anything?
i copied the resutls here http://rafb.net/p/0K2mx869.html
are you using a wired connection? or wireless?
i've both
ok, run "ifup eth0" as root
give me :  Ignoring unknown device eth0=eth0
I don't kow what to recommend, except restart Ubuntu and run "ifconfig" again, see if eth0 shows up
run "lspci | grep -i ethernet"
run "lspci | grep -i ethernet", what does it say?
gived me : 00:19.0 Ethernet controller: Intel Corporation 82566DC-2 Gigabit Network Connection (rev 02)
do you have physical connectivity between PC and router?
thanks! i'm tring to substituite the cable, but i have wi-fi too, so i think it must detect it :-/
ok, run this as root and post the results "cat /etc/network/interfaces"
is not the cable ... tring to both from the installation cd the ethernet works .. so the cable is not broken, the cat output is : http://rafb.net/p/QHyZEs78.html
seems that the interface file is without the needed parameters insi it !  need i to add the connection parameters inside the interface file ?
that file needs to look like this: http://dserban.dyndns.org:8181/interfaces.txt
i modified it, how to restart the network ?
/etc/init.d/networking restart as root
